oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Association between Clinical Signs and Microbiology Results in Dairy Cattle Suspected of Clinical Salmonellosis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Aubry, P.
Bigras-Poulin, M.
Cripps, C. J.
Warnick, L. D.
Nydam, D. V.
Grohn, Y. T.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Salmonella spp
subclinical infection
bacteremia
endotoxemia
enteritis
abortion
dry gangrene
dairy cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Infection with Salmonella spp can cause a variety of diseases in the bovine species, from subclinical infections to bacteremia, endotoxemia and death, as well as enteritis, abortion or dry gangrene of the extremities in calves. The aim of our study was to determine which clinical signs were associated with a diagnosis of salmonellosis in dairy cattle.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2008; 246
